page.title: 15FARMLAND,IPSWICH FRINGE.
page.content: The southern edge of Ipswich has no definite boundary when you visit the area.Ipswich may have a boundary on the map,but any person who views the area from the Orwell Bridge will notice that farmland is being swallowed up by a spreading town(i.e houses and roads). Farms have actually been overtaken by the towns growth and form an island of greenery in a sea of builings. Most of the farming is given over to arable crops. The land ,soil and climate being ideally suited to the growing of cereals like wheat and barley and to sugar-beet. How long before more land is taken up by the town and its roads?
